image.altText: CFMEU's Michael Ravbar (left) and Jade Ingham

items.synopsis: The 54-year-old man suffered "extensive" internal injuries after falling at the Cross River Rail site, hitting a "penetration" in his fall, and remains in a critical condition.

title.children: Son of worker critically injured after falling 12 metres at Brisbane construction site saw it happen, union claims

image.altText: A composite image of two women.

items.synopsis: A childcare boss's decision after learning two of her staff had left a three-year-old on a bus in central Queensland for several hours has been credited with saving the girl's life.

title.children: Tears as women who left child on daycare bus sentenced over 'nightmare situation'

image.altText: People are seen in the lower part of the image wearing hard hats while the volcano erupts in the background.

items.synopsis: The trial over the deadly 2019 Whakaari White Island eruption has heard there was a 5 per cent chance multiple people would die during tours of the volcano.

title.children: One in 20 chance of a 'mass casualty event' on White Island, expert tells court

image.altText: Naomoto Hikaru celebrates

items.synopsis: Former FIFA Women's World Cup winners Nadeshiko Japan get the points first up on day seven against Costa Rica. Coming up is Spain vs Zambia in Auckland and Ireland against Canada in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Japan cruise to victory over Costa Rica - next up, Spain vs Zambia

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Not quite as spectacular as the previous, but no less memorable for Jennifer Hermoso, who heads in from about a yard out on the occasion of her 100th cap for Spain. It was a decent cross from the left, but the defence was all over the place and this could end up being a very long night for the Copper Queens.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 13' Spain has two!

children.content: Not quite as spectacular as the previous, but no less memorable for
Jennifer Hermoso, who heads in from about a yard out on the occasion of her 100th cap for Spain.
It was a decent cross from the left, but the defence was all over the place and this could end up being a very long night for the Copper Queens.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Oh that's a glorious finish! Teresa Abelleira has let fly from outside the penalty area and the ball has flown into the top corner of the goal! That's the goal of this World Cup so far - and it will take some beating! Glorious stuff!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 9' SPAIN SCORES A SCREAMER!

children.content: Oh that's a glorious finish! Teresa Abelleira has let fly from outside the penalty area and the ball has flown into the top corner of the goal!
That's the goal of this World Cup so far - and it will take some beating!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: So, just the two goals for Japan, who are all but through to the last 16 after a second-successive clean sheet victory. Incredibly that was the first time Nadeshiko Japan have kept consecutive clean sheets at a World Cup in 35 matches. Japan has a whopping 24 shots in that game, 12 on target, so will they be a bit frustrated that they could only score two? Perhaps. But it's not goals that they needed tonight, just the three points. You'd think Spain will provide a sterner test next time out when they meet in Wellington/Ta Whanganui-a-Tara on Monday, but that's a then problem. For Costa Rica though, that's a second-straight defeat that essentially puts them out of the tournament.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Comfortable win for Japan

children.content: So, just the two goals for Japan, who are all but through to the last 16 after a second-successive clean sheet victory.
Incredibly that was the first time Nadeshiko Japan have kept consecutive clean sheets at a World Cup in 35 matches.
Japan has a whopping 24 shots in that game, 12 on target, so will they be a bit frustrated that they could only score two? Perhaps.
But it's not goals that they needed tonight, just the three points.
You'd think Spain will provide a sterner test next time out when they meet in Wellington/Ta Whanganui-a-Tara on Monday, but that's a then problem.
For Costa Rica though, that's a second-straight defeat that essentially puts them out of the tournament.

image.altText: A bald man in black tshirt and woman with long dark hair and grey jumper work in a drycleaning facility surrounded by machinery.

items.synopsis: Inflation has slowed down again, with consumer prices up 6 per cent over the year to June, below most economists' forecasts and reducing the chance of an RBA rate rise next week.

title.children: Inflation falls faster than expected. Has the Reserve Bank already increased interest rates too far?

image.altText: Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis side-by-side with his brain scan

items.synopsis: The effect of head knocks over Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis's decades-long sporting career isn’t immediately obvious. That is, until you see what’s happening to his brain.

title.children: From the age of 4, Gordi played contact sports. See how it has impacted his brain

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie

items.synopsis: Police say 31-year-old Mahmoud Abbas was shot by an unknown man outside a property in Greenacre this morning.

title.children: Sydney lawyer shot on same street where underworld figure was killed last year

image.altText: A pilot whale seen underwater, as a man tries to shepherd the animal to deeper water.

items.synopsis: Authorities are urging the public to stay clear as they work to save the lives of the remaining 45 pilot whales stranded on Cheynes Beach.

title.children: 'Devastating': 52 whales dead on WA beach as difficult rescue effort continues

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses talks into a microphone

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old man who sent a threatening message to author Yumi Stynes tells the media outside court he has a lot to do to "grow as a person".

title.children: Man who sent threatening message to Yumi Stynes apologises outside court

image.altText: GCB Constructions signage with crane above

items.synopsis: Gold Coast company GCB Constructions was forced to stop work on Tuesday, in what has been described by the state's Master Builders association as a blow to the city's ability to complete large-scale apartment projects.

title.children: Major Gold Coast construction company goes into administration after licence suspended

image.altText: An aerial shot of a coastal forest

items.synopsis: A year after it was initially scheduled to open to the public, construction is underway on the Wangetti Trail — designed to take hikers and mountain bikers through the Wet Tropics World Heritage Area between Cairns and Port Douglas.

title.children: Work finally begins on delayed 94km trail through World Heritage rainforest in Far North Queensland

image.altText: fresh fruit in aisles of a grocery shop

items.synopsis: Market traders are betting that the Reserve Bank will keep interest rates on hold again next month after consumer inflation pulled back from April to June.

title.children: ASX surges to five-month high as inflation falls to 6 per cent raising hopes of another Reserve Bank rate pause — as it happened

image.altText: Photograph outside the Australian Tax Office headquarters

items.synopsis: Following an ABC Investigation, the Australian Tax Office admits criminals have fraudulently claimed more than $557 million from the Commonwealth using an identity loophole.

title.children: ATO admits identity loophole exposed by the ABC tops half a billion dollars

image.altText: Geoff and Rhonda doing a puzzle.

items.synopsis: Geoff is selectively mute and has a fragile X syndrome. When his mother engaged a disability service to take him to work, she didn't know it would use up almost all his NDIS funding.

title.children: Geoff was driven to work three days a week. He received a $700 invoice for it

image.altText: A female footballer in a gold Australia jersey smiles and celebrates with her arm extended, celebrating a goal

items.synopsis: With Sam Kerr already on the sidelines, the Matildas lose Mary Fowler ahead of their clash with Nigeria in Brisbane.

title.children: Matildas lose another attacking weapon in crucial World Cup clash with Nigeria

image.altText: A close up of a man speaking while gesturing with his hand

items.synopsis: The announcement comes after the ABC obtained vision showing multiple greyhounds, including puppies, apparently being kicked and punched by a person on a property south-east of Adelaide.

title.children: SA government announces greyhound inquiry following ABC report into alleged mistreatment

image.altText: Timothy Shea stands outside the glass doors of Manhattan federal court.

items.synopsis: A Colorado businessman receives the longest prison sentenced yet imposed over a fraudulent scheme to raise money for Donald Trump's border wall.

title.children: A non-profit raised millions for Trump's border wall. Here's why a third man behind the campaign has been sentenced

image.altText: A man throws his fists in the air at a Brussels bombings memorial.

items.synopsis: The six were found guilty of murder for their part in twin Brussels airport bombings, and a bombing on the city's metro.

title.children: Six found guilty in Brussels terrorist bombings that killed 32 people

image.altText: A close-up view of e-scooter wheels.

items.synopsis: The 15-year-olds were airlifted to Perth after colliding with a ute in Karratha. Police and doctors fear there will be more incidents to come.

title.children: Teens badly hurt in outback e-scooter crash as police grapple with reckless riding

image.altText: Two giant solar panel car parks

items.synopsis: Almost 6,000 solar panels have been installed by Treasury Wine Estates, with the ability to generate more than 5,000 megawatt-hours of energy per year — the equivalent of powering around 900 homes.

title.children: Largest winery solar panel system in Australia switches on in the Barossa Valley

image.altText: A man wearing a mask

items.synopsis: Damian Wanstall, who previously taught maths at Kellyville High School, was unaware the person he was engaging with online in 2020 was actually an undercover police officer and was arrested when he arranged to meet.

title.children: 'He certainly had a sexual motivation': Former teacher jailed after online advert looking for young girl

image.altText: A school zone sign in front of a tree

items.synopsis: After six months and two school terms, the Queensland government has confirmed the cameras have not resulted in a single fine for speeding motorists.

title.children: No fines issued since school zone speed cameras switched on due to 'technical issues'

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

items.synopsis: State and territory governments are not being held accountable for failing to meet Closing the Gap targets and in some cases are actively exacerbating disadvantage, a Productivity Commission report finds.

title.children: 'Another broken promise to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people': Report warns of continued disadvantage

image.altText: Metro West sign

items.synopsis: The offer comes after NSW Premier Chris Minns repeatedly refused to guarantee the underground line will go ahead.

title.children: Developers offer to help bankroll Metro West line, if they can build additional homes

image.altText: A smiling young woman takes a selfie. A man, whose face is blurred, sits beside her.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has been asked by the Crown to put illegal drug use aside as it deliberates over the fate of Danielle Easey's accused killer.

title.children: Jurors asked to put Danielle Easey's lifestyle 'to one side' as end of murder trial looms

image.altText: A man with long hair and a green cap looks at the camera with trees behind him

items.synopsis: Police have abandoned a search for the 22-year-old man who went missing in rugged terrain on Magnetic Island more than a year ago.

title.children: Search for young Magnetic Island man called off

image.altText: David Pass sits in the in Queensland Health's Forensic and Scientific Services lab, boxes of vapes stand nearby

items.synopsis: Impounded vapes are being tested for polonium-210, a radioisotope which naturally occurs in cigarette tobacco.

title.children: Scientists suspect vapes contain 'weapon of espionage' polonium-210 after finding cancer-causing substances

image.altText: Meta logo in background in focus with blurry silhouette heads in foreground.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court hears Meta used a free security app promoted as protecting data but the tech giant used it to find out "nearly everything" users were doing on their devices.

title.children: Free security app 'knows nearly everything' about users, court told as Facebook owners Meta fined $20m

image.altText: Composite image of young girl and police members and a search dog.

items.synopsis: Police say they are acting on information they've received from the public in searching an area 50 minutes away from where missing teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell was last seen.

title.children: Massive bushland search for missing Tasmanian teen Shyanne-Lee to run until Friday

image.altText: A jockey in red, white and blue silks rides a camel at high speed, with feet in stirrups, strop in hand and hair flying.

items.synopsis: She's best known as a travelling tent boxer with leg hairs so sharp "they could spear a rat" but Beaver Brophy, who has a CV that reads like a handful of darts thrown at a careers handbook, has added a bizarre new skill to her list of qualifications.

title.children: Travelling tent boxer Beaver Brophy becomes camel racing champion in Queensland outback

image.altText: A woman's hands type on a laptop keyboard.

items.synopsis: A Byron Bay woman's $1.8m legal nightmare highlights how hackers use username and password combinations leaked online to access other accounts, a scam on the rise due to recent major data breaches, experts warn.

title.children: Why you need to know about 'credential stuffing' — the latest way scammers are targeting your data

image.altText: two men at night stood near a bus station smiling at camera

items.synopsis: It's a different way to tackle youth crime in a state with a rising young offender arrest rate, and a suite of new tough-on-crime laws.

title.children: 'Call us, we're happy to come get you': See what it's like on a ride-along with a different kind of police patrol
